intro: Matelea trichopedicellata, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The plant is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
